cards.data: And in West Berlin there was always a sense that you were right up against the wall, and surrounded by a country and a system that was hostile
Overall an authoritarian regime, lots of rules and regulations. The wall was heavily defended to prevent people escaping to West Berlin. Less commerce in East Germany with the USSR clearly in control
We had a special pass called flag orders that enabled us to cross the border without leaving your car
Conflict between US and USSR. If you were an American imprisoned in East Germany it was difficult to get released. Escape over the wall was virtually impossible
[Citizens who wish to leave] are forced to depart illegally because the restrictions on foreign travel by the government make legal travel almost impossible
East German citizens are required to have visas and passports to enter West Germany, and those are extremely hard to come by. Only at the invitation of a relative can those be obtained
Travel restriction violations being considered criminal acts is essentially unique to communist authoritarian regimes like East Germany
It is a crime punishable by imprisonment to unlawfully enter the country, disobey travel restrictions, and violate limits on time spent in the country
